head.title: World Business Briefing | Asia: Philippines: Airport Contract Voided

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Manufacturing, Operations and Logistics

hedline.hl1: World Business Briefing | Asia: Philippines: Airport Contract Voided

abstract.p: Philippine Supreme Court invalidates contract awarded to group of investors, including Germany's Fraport, to build new international air terminal in Manila; court says partners did not have 'requisite financial capacity' to complete project when contract was awarded in 1997; Fraport will appeal (S)

block.p: The Philippine Supreme Court has invalidated the contract awarded to a group of investors, including the German operator of the Frankfurt airport, to build a new international air terminal in Manila. The court said the partners did not have the ''requisite financial capacity'' to complete the project when the contract was awarded in 1997. The German company, Fraport, said it expected to appeal the ruling and would seek compensation for the terminal, which is completed but not open.

The German company, Fraport, said it expected to appeal the ruling and would seek compensation for the terminal, which is completed but not open.
